title: Moral Luck and AI Decision-Making
subtitle: Evaluating Ethics When Chance and Unforeseen Circumstances Influence Outcomes
description: Explore how unpredictable outcomes and chance events complicate the moral evaluation of AI decisions, learning to fairly assess algorithmic choices when luck and unforeseen circumstances influence results.
learningObjectives: Understand how chance and unforeseen circumstances affect moral evaluation of AI decisions
Analyze the difference between evaluating decision-making processes versus outcomes
Examine the challenge of assigning responsibility in probabilistic and uncertain environments
Evaluate how to fairly assess AI system performance when luck influences results
Design frameworks for ethical evaluation that account for uncertainty and chance

preparationGuide.overview: This lab explores a sophisticated challenge in AI ethics: how to fairly evaluate decisions and assign responsibility when chance, luck, and unforeseen circumstances significantly influence outcomes.
keyFocusAreas: Different types of moral luck and their philosophical implications
How to evaluate AI systems when outcomes are influenced by factors beyond control
Responsibility attribution in probabilistic and uncertain environments
Design of fair evaluation systems that account for chance and uncertainty
commonMisconceptions: Good outcomes always indicate good decision-making processes
Bad luck absolves decision-makers of all responsibility
AI systems should be evaluated solely on their outcomes
Uncertainty makes moral evaluation impossible or irrelevant

discussionPrompts: How should we evaluate AI systems when their success depends partly on factors beyond their control?
What is the difference between a good decision and a good outcome?
How do cultural and contextual factors influence how we handle moral luck?
What are the implications of moral luck for AI system design and deployment?
extensionActivities: Research how different professions handle uncertainty and moral luck in their evaluation systems
Interview professionals who make decisions under uncertainty about their evaluation frameworks
Analyze recent AI failures or successes to identify the role of chance and unforeseen factors
Design evaluation systems for AI applications in specific high-uncertainty domains

vocabulary.definition: Circumstances where factors beyond an agent's control influence the moral evaluation of their actions
Moral luck related to the character traits and dispositions a person happens to have
Moral luck related to the situations and circumstances a person encounters
Moral luck related to how actions turn out, which may be influenced by chance
Assessing the quality of decision-making procedures rather than focusing solely on outcomes

crossCurricular.philosophy: Exploring concepts of responsibility, causation, and moral evaluation
crossCurricular.statistics: Understanding probability, uncertainty, and statistical evaluation methods
crossCurricular.psychology: Learning about human decision-making under uncertainty and attribution biases
crossCurricular.law: Examining legal approaches to causation, negligence, and responsibility
crossCurricular.risk-management: Understanding how various fields handle uncertainty and unpredictable outcomes

reflectionQuestions: How has this lab influenced your thinking about evaluating decisions when outcomes are uncertain?
Can you think of situations in your own life where moral luck played a role in how you or others were evaluated?
How do you balance outcome-based and process-based evaluation in your own decision-making?
What implications does moral luck have for how we should design and deploy AI systems?
How might understanding moral luck change how society approaches AI governance and regulation?
